piano

Class Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • piano.Key

  • public class Key
extends java.lang.Object
    This class sets properties of a Piano's Key object.
    Author:
    rithika, amanda, and keertana 4/5/18 V1

    • Constructor Detail

      • Key

        public Key(java.lang.String l,
           Sound s,
           boolean isBlack)
        Creates a piano key with a letter, sound and color
        Parameters:
        l - the piano letter that identifies the key
        s - the sound specified by the key
        isBlack - whether the key is black or not
        Postcondition:
        width of black keys is set to (int) (0.5 * 75) height of black keys is set to (int) (3.5 * 75) width of white keys is set to (int) (0.8 *75 height of white keys is set to (int) (5.5 * 75)

      • Key

        public Key(java.lang.String l,
           java.lang.String k,
           boolean isBlack)
        Creates a piano key with a piano letter, key letter, and color
        Parameters:
        l - the piano letter that identifies the key
        k - the keyboard letter to press that correlates to the piano letter
        isBlack - whether the key is black or not
        Postcondition:
        width of black keys is set to (int) (0.5 * 75) height of black keys is set to (int) (3.5 * 75) width of white keys is set to (int) (0.8 *75 height of white keys is set to (int) (5.5 * 75)

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draws one key
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics object the method is acting on.
        x - the x-value of the key's top left corner
        y - the y-value of the key's top left corner
        Postcondition:
        if the key is being pressed, the key is yellow, otherwise it is black or white depending on the key each key has a black outline each key's piano letter is printed above or below them each key's keyboard letter is printed in them, calls super.paintComponent, makes rectangle of (x,y,width, height) to draw key, has sharp notes filled in black and normal notes filled in white, outline color of key is black.
